unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify and discuss the key interpreting theories and apply enhanced analytical skills in communication via reflection on interpreting practice.
Conduct Chinese English dialogue interpreting in community
Understand and apply the AUSIT (Australian Institute of Interpreters and Translators) Code of Ethics
Conduct sight translation from English into Chinese

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on shadowing/interpreting practice, reflection of their practice and going through relevant materials provided in iLearn to prepare for all the activities in class.

assessments.description: Students are to deliver a speech and interpret a speech delivered by a peer student in class.
Students are to take notes for and reflect on their interpreting practice and submit a reflective journal.
Students are to do a dialogue interpreting, a sight translation and answer an ethics question orally online via synchronous and/or asynchronous activities.
Students will complete this task online via synchronous and/or asynchronous activities.
Students are to do a dialogue interpreting, a sight translation and answer an ethics question orally in class.
Students are to read and watch provided materials in iLearn and join the in class discussion, as well as provide comments on peer students’ practice.
Students are to read and watch provided materials in iLearn and join the in synchronous and/or asynchronous discussion, as well as provide comments on peer students’ practice.
Students are to practice at home and take practice based tasks in class.
Students are to deliver a speech and interpret a speech delivered by a peer student. Students will complete this task online via synchronous and/or asynchronous activities.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is for interpreting training between Mandarin Chinese and English at an advanced level. Students will learn how to apply the AUSIT (Australian Institute of Interpreters and Translators) Code of Ethics in different scenarios, such as community interpreting practice. Students will also enhance their understanding of interpreting theories and skills and be able to conduct Chinese-English dialogue interpreting and sight translation. Their inter-lingual communication skills will be further developed which will contribute to their future learning and work.
data.title: Chinese-English-Chinese Interpreting II

description: This unit is for interpreting training between Mandarin Chinese and English at an advanced level. Students will learn how to apply the AUSIT (Australian Institute of Interpreters and Translators) Code of Ethics in different scenarios, such as community interpreting practice. Students will also enhance their understanding of interpreting theories and skills and be able to conduct Chinese-English dialogue interpreting and sight translation. Their inter-lingual communication skills will be further developed which will contribute to their future learning and work.
title: Chinese-English-Chinese Interpreting II
